chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Keyshawn Jamel Dixon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Flee Or Elude An Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Drive or Operate A Vehicle Without Owner's Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution set at $7,163.69 payable to Amanda S.  Bond on deposit to be applied to restitution.

Provide DNA sample.
Court ordered the defendant to pay DNA surcharge and restitution during the term of probation. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.
Court waived all other court costs, fees and surcharges due to a finding of indigency. 
If revoked Court ordered that DNA surcharge and restitution  be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Full time work/school, mimimum of 25 hours of work per week if in school.
Work on obtaining  a GED/HSD/HSED.
Court allows expungement upon successful completion of probation and obtaining 3 college credits.

Complete 8 hours of in person adult drivers education.
Obtain a valid drivers license.
5 page double spaced letter of apology or learned experience.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

defendant.name: Dixon, Keyshawn Jamel

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #2

Defendant Keyshawn Jamel Dixon in court with attorney Brian Nelson.  Defendant Keyshawn Jamel Dixon in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:
Defendant changes pleas to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's pleas.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  Sentencing proceeded. 

...
Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 42 MONTHS with 53 days credit, CONCURRENT to Count 2; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 MONTHS.

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 42 MONTHS, CONCURRENT to Count 1; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 MONTHS.

The Court STAYED these sentences and placed the defendant on probation for 3 YEARS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
- Provide DNA sample.
- Complete 75 hours of community service. 
- Complete 8 HOURS of IN PERSON ADULT driver's education.
- Obtain a valid driver's license. 
- 5 page double spaced letter of apology or learned experience. 
- Full-time work/school (minimum of 25 hours of work per week if in school). 
- Work on obtaining a GED/HSD/HSED
- Restitution set at $7,163.69 payable to Amanda Sly.  Bond on deposit shall be applied towards restitution. 

*Court allows expungement upon successful completion of probation and obtaining 3 college credits. 


Court ordered the defendant to pay DNA surcharge AND restitution during the term of probation. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.  Court waived all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to a finding of indigency.  

If revoked, Court ordered that DNA surcharge AND restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

20 day appeal rights given.
Received and Filed: Jury Instruction
Received and Filed: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum
Received and Filed: State's Offer
Received and Filed: Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant Keyshawn Jamel Dixon in court with Attorney Brian Nelson.  Defendant Keyshawn Jamel Dixon in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel. Defense notices an error in the information. Parties request an adjournment. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Arraignment scheduled for March 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Keyshawn Jamel Dixon not in court, defendant in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No driving without a valid license.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Amanda S or co actor DH 1/15/03

Defendant Keyshawn Jamel Dixon in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant Keyshawn Jamel Dixon in custody.  Mario Fiumefreddo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Keyshawn Jamel Dixon appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
